text.section:
The Governor may have the State seal:
to affix it to a certified copy of a law or resolution;
to affix it to a communication from the State to the United States, another state, or a foreign country; or
as needed for any other purpose for which law provides.

The Governor may not affix the State seal to a document or allow the State seal to be affixed to a document that the Executive Branch of the State government issues, unless the Governor signs the document.
